situation: L found it hard to transition from group activities to independent work, often crying and holding onto his group materials.
action: Introducing a 'transition book' where L could stick images of completed group work helped create closure on activities. Affirmative praise from the teacher when closing one activity and starting another provided encouragement.
effect: The transition book gave L a visual record of his successes, making the process of moving from group work to independence less daunting. Positive reinforcement strengthened his confidence to approach individual tasks.
topic: Transition Difficulties - Moving between different activities or spaces
